RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since July 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARLA'S HONOR stalked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two wide in the drive to get up in time. NINE OCLOCK CEASER away well and raced to the lead from along the rail in the run to the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of TAM TRICKY in the run down the backside, continued to battle with that rival through the final turn, but was unable to fend off a late surge by CARLA'S HONOR while proving clearly second best. TOBESUNNY unhurried early while dropping back to trail in the run to the first turn, bided his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backside, commenced her bid four wide entering the final turn, and finished with late interest three wide in the drive to get up for a share. ISLAND LIVING away alertly and was allowed to settle off the contested pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, mounted a two wide bid entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing at the rail in the lane. TAM TRICKY broke sharply and pressed the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on his pace rival leaving the turn, and weakened in the stretch drive. STRIKING VALUE stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, struggled to maintain her position in the run to the final turn, and had little to offer when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Carla's Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Nine Oclock Ceaser
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2w, rallied 2w, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Tam Tricky
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 16 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 16 Al lowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAJESTIC STREET away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace from along the inside of two rivals in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, shook clear of his pace rivals leaving the turn, and was all out to repel the late challenge from KNOPFLER while drifting three wide under left handed urging. KNOPFLER broke sharply and stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, began to advance two wide from between rivals midway down the backstretch, rallied smartly four wide through the final turn, and closed steadily three out from the rail in the drive to just miss. DRILLER tracked the battling leaders while saving ground along the inside in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside through the final turn while awaiting room, and closed from along the inside in the drive to garner a share. ANOTHER GUINNESS unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied three wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, and continued three wide in the drive while improving his position. RING OF KERRY away alertly and pressed the pace three wide in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, and was outfinished late. I'M A CHI TOO dueled for the lead from between rivals in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, struggled to keep tabs on his pace rival leaving the turn, and faded in the stretch drive. FRANKIE MACHINE stalked the contested early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide into the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: I'm a Chi Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Ring of Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Frankie Machine
ENTRY.OWNER: Willow Creek Farms and Chiesa Fabio
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Knopfler
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2w, advanced 3/8, rallied 4w, closed 4 w

ENTRY.NAME: Another Guinness
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Sadie Diamond Futurity HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR BC BRED OR BC SIRED TWO YEAR OLD FILLIES. By subscription of $50 for each mare-in-foal or foal on ground nominated on or before April 8, 2021. To remain eligible a further subscription of $100 is due by Midnight Saturday April 1, 2023 (Two-Year-Old). Final payment of $200 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday September 9, 2023 with $1500 to enter and an additional $2,000 to start. $100,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth , and 2% to sixth through eighth. Supplemental nominations will be accepted if a sustaining payment is missed, but only if the Mare in foal was originally nominated. The supplemental fee is $5000 and due at time of entry Nominations are non-refundable. Pr eference will be based upon the rules outlined in Hastings condition book at the time of entry. Weight: 122 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 twice allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners of $10,000 allowed 7 lbs. Field limited to 11s
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIZZIE'S RAYNE away well and vied for the lead from the inside of VIVA LA DIVA in the run down the backstretch, continued to set a pressured pace from the inside of that rival through the final turn, got the better of her pace rival in mid stretch and held of a late surge by EDDIE'S GIRL late to prevail. EDDIE'S GIRL away alertly and stalked the dueling leaders in the run down the backside while saving ground along the inside, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, and was gaining late three wide in deep stretch in an impressive debut. VIVA LA DIVA dueled for the lead from the outside of LIZZIE'S RAYNE entering the backstretch, continued to press that rival two wide through the final turn, struggled to match strides with her pace rival in mid stretch, and was outfinished late. SKYSABLAZING unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and found her best stride late while finishing two out from the rail in the drive. DONNA WYN broke sharply and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the late going.

ENTRY.NAME: Skysablazing
ENTRY.OWNER: Emlyn Brian Kiehlbauch Laura Little Glen Conley Bruce and Unwin Bruce
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzie's Rayne
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing Breen Racing Chan Eugene and Milburn Dave
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Eddie's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Diva
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Donna Wyn
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied inside, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO $5,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED AT THE 2023 MEET AND HAVE NOT FINISHED 1ST, 2ND OR 3RD AT THE CURRENT MEET. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. (Horse s that win this condition are no longer eligible for this condition while all other starters in this condition remain eligible.)(Winning this race will not be considered in eligibility in any other condition maidens excluded). British Columbia Bred Claimi ng Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZ MEOW broke sharply and raced to the lead from just off the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace on an uncontested lead in the run down the backside, maintained a clear lead through the final turn, and widened his advantage late while under confident handling. BODEGA away alertly and tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while saving ground along the inside, commenced his bid from just off the rail entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to prove easily second best. VALUE MAX away well and stalked the pacesetter in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to garner a share. TIMELESS SHRUG unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive, but was only able to pass a tiring rival. SIR BARCLAY tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Value Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bodega
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E and Doyle Maurice
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Timeless Shrug
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Meow
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led, drew clear, ridden out

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Barclay
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 21000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING SINCE JANUARY 16. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 16 Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PURSUE settled off the contested early pace while racing two out from the rail through the stretch the first time, launched his bid four wide entering the final turn, swept to the lead entering the lane, and was never seriously threatened late under confident handling. COUNTERACT away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained a striking position in the run down the backstretch, rallied one out from the rail through the final turn while awaiting room, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to get up for a share. BRIAN'S DE LEIGHT away alertly and pressed the pacesetter two wide through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, but fought on gamely from along the inside in the drive to prove clearly best of the rest. EMPEROROFTHENORTH stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, began to advance midway down the backside, engaged the leaders three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to sustain his bid in the late going. NEIGHBOR settled off the early pace while saving ground through the stretch the first time, commenced his bid from along the rail entering he final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive, but lacked a serious late bid. LOVEABOVEANDBEYOND broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the rail entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Loveaboveandbeyond
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, inched clear

ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Emperorofthenorth
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, advanced 3/8, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Neighbor
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied inside, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Jack Diamond Futurity HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR BC BRED OR BC SIRED TWO YEAR OLD COLTS AND GELDINGS. By subscription of $50 for each mare-in-foal or foal on ground nominated on or before April 8, 2021. To remain eligible a further subscription of $100 is due by Saturday April 1, 2023 (Two-Year-Ol d). Final payment of $200 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday September 9, 2023 with $1500 to enter and an additional $2,000 to start. $100,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fi fth, and 2% to sixth through eighth. Supplemental nominations will be accepted if a sustaining payment is missed, but only if the Mare in foal was originally nominated. The supplemental fee is $5000 and due at time of entry. Nominations are non-refundable . Preference will be based upon the rules outlined in Hastings condition book at the time of entry. Weight: 122 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 twice allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners of $10,000 allowed 7 lbs. Field limited to
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WEALTHY TEXAN away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch, increased that lead through the final turn, and was never threatened late while proving best. VECTOR broke sharply and tracked the leader into the first turn while under snug restraint, held his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive while laying in late. NORTHERN FORCE away alertly and stalked the leaders through the first turn while racing just out from the rail, dropped back in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and closed two wide in he drive to garner a share. DIOCLES unhurried early while taking up slightly at the start, trailed the field in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid three out from the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response late while finishing four wide in the drive. HORATIO settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, began to gain ground on the leader in the run to the final turn, rallied from along the inside through the turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive. AUGUST RAIN settled off the early pace while racing three wide in the run down the backstretch, carried on three wide into the final turn, but failed to make a late impact while finishing two out from the rail in the drive. PISCO tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Vector
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Wealthy Texan
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, clear lead, best

ENTRY.NAME: Pisco
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked inside, dropped back, rallied rail

ENTRY.OWNER: Wil - A - Way Farm Jewsbury Gail C and Jarvis Pat
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Horatio
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: August Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: British Columbia Oaks HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 83. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR THREE YEAR OLD FILLIES. By subscription of $150 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday September 9, 2023. With an additional $1,125 to enter and $1,500 to start. A supplemental nomination fee of $3,750 will be accepted at the time of entry in addition to the races nomination, entry and start fees. 100% of all supplemental monies will be included in the $75,000 guaranteed purse. $75,000 guaranteed, with 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% six th through eighth. Preference will be based on lifetime earnings as recorded by Equibase at time of entry. Weight : 124 lbs. Field will be limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ABOVE AVERAGE away alertly and tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, maintained her position through the second turn and into the backstretch, collared the pacesetter midway down the backside, and battled with that rival through the final turn and into the lane, began to get the better of her pace rival in mid stretch, and inched clear late while laying in under left handed urging. AIR FORCE away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace through the second turn and into the backstretch, battled from the inside of ABOVE AVERAGE through the final turn and into the stretch, steadied in mid stretch when losing her path, and finished just out from the rail late while holding the place. MATSQUI stalked the leader into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained her position through the second turn and in the run down the backside, rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, and shifted three wide entering the lane, and closed two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. JAMIES INHERITANCE broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, was called on to keep up while racing three wide entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed six wide in the drive. KEY TO SUCCESS stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more while finishing four wide in the drive. FORCE TO REKN WITH settled off the early pace while saving ground along the inside entering the stretch the first time, held her position into the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid while finishing five wide in the drive. ARUNDEL CASTLE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, was always well back and failed to make a late impact. Following the running of this race, there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of AIR FORCE lodged a claim of foul against the rider of ABOVE AVERAGE for alleged interference in mid stretch. Ater review, the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish

ENTRY.OWNER: Dale Dennis Peter Morris and Welsh Ed
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, steadied late

ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: British Columbia Derby - Grade3 HASTINGS RACE 8 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 93. Stakes Purse 125000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. By subscription of $250 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday September 9, 2023. with an additional $1,875 to enter and $2,500 to start. A supplemental nomination fee of $6,250 will be accepted at the time of entry in add ition to the races nomination, entry and start fees. 100% of all supplemental monies will be included in the $125,000 guaranteed purse. $125,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2%s ixth through eighth. Preference will be based on lifetime earnings as recorded by Equibase at time of entry. Weight : Colts and Geldings 126 lbs. Fillies 121 lbs. Field will be limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACCIDENTAL HERO tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained his position into the backstretch, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, collared SUNBIRD midway through the turn, and prevailed over that stubborn rival in the closing strides while finishing three out from the rail. SUNBIRD away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of IT'S A FACT through the stretch the first time and in the run down the backstretch, got the better of his pace rival soon after entering the final turn, but was quickly collared by ACCIDENTAL HERO, and just failed to last. SPACE broke sharply and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time, maintained his position through the second turn and in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the rail through the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to prove easily best of the rest. KYSTONE settled at the back of a compact field entering the stretch the first time, was pushed along mid way down the backside, rallied smartly three wide entering he final turn, but was unable to sustain his early run in the lane. IT'S A FACT away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of SUNBIRD entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide through the second turn and in the run down the backside, chased the pacesetter into the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Kystone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Space
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied rail, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Accidental Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Sunbird
ENTRY.OWNER: Felicella Pauline and Estate of Nick Felicella
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 3 w, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: It's a Fact
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Col umbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUAGMIRE away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, and prevailed in the final strides over a very stubborn pace rival. VALUABLE COWBOY away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of QUAGMIRE entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and continued to do battle with that foe through the lane, and just missed. WISE MARKET stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. FOOT SOLDIER broke sharply and stalked the leaders one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, was pushed out entering the lane, and closed four wide in the drive. MORETHANSOULTITLE settled off the contested early pace while racing two wide entering the backstretch, commenced his bid four wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid while finishing five wide in the drive. CALAMAZEUS settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, steadied briefly when in tight quarters leaving the turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive. BARNEY GOOGLE unhurried early while dropping well behind the field entering the first turn, was always well behind, and gained ground late, but failed to make a late impact. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of FOOT SOLDIER lodged a claim of foul against the rider of WISE MARKET for alleged interference entering the stretch. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Quagmire
ENTRY.OWNER: Henson Lorie Klimes Helen and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, closed rail, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Calamazeus
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, steadied 3/16, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, nipped

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,
